question: 在留
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: The place you're <kanji>detain</kanji>ed is where you <kanji>exist</kanji>. As long as you're in this place, this will be your <vocabulary>residence</vocabulary>. Note: mainly means "residence" in the broader sense and is parts of words like "residence card" or "foreign residents."
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
